text: Jacques-Louis Monod (25 February 1927 - 21 September 2020) was a French composer, pianist and conductor. He conducted the musical works of Charles Ives, Edgard Varèse, Arnold Schoenberg, Anton Webern and uptown music. He was born in Asnières-sur-Seine, France. Monod died on 21 September 2020 in Toulouse, France at the age of 93.Jacques-Louis Monod, Modernist Composer With a Lyrical Touch, Dies at 93 ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2020 deaths Category:20th-century French composers Category:French conductors Category:French pianists Category:21st-century French composers
title: Jacques-Louis Monod
